fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
The transition tab uses the user_key when logging transitions, not the user_name. Due to this design, when a user renames his username, the transition tab keeps using the "old name", as it is the user_key.

h3. Suggested Solution
Change the design of the transition tab (and the new feature that will replace the transition tab) to use the user_name instead of the user_key.

h3. Why this is important
Enhance the user and admin experience.

h3. Workaround 
There is no workaround for this.
fields.summary: Transitions tab should use user_name and not user_key

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The issue preview is not working properly in the Slack room.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Have a Jira-Slack integration properly set up
# Paste one issue URL or key in the Slack room

h3. Expected Results
Once you paste the URL or just the issue key in the Slack room, the issue preview should be rendered:
 !issue-preview.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results
The preview does not work.

h3. Notes
The issue preview works when you use the command */jira KEY-123*

h3.Workaround
None
fields.summary: The issue preview is not working properly in the Slack room

fields.description:
When you delete a Group linked, Jira needs to delete all relations in the system. 
It seems that not all relations are deleted and it is a problem.
fields.summary: Delete Group and All Relations

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Previous Status Condition is displayed incorrectly if the condition is reversed.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add a *Previous Status Condition* to a transition on your workflow and check the *Reverse condition* box.

!Update_Workflow_Transition_Previous_Status_Condition_Condition_-_Jira.png|thumbnail!
h3. Expected Results

The Issue must have *not* been in Status *TEST* at some point before its current Status.
h3. Actual Results

The Issue must have been in Status *TEST* at some point before its current Status.

!Transition__In_Progress_-_Jira.png|thumbnail!

h3. Notes
This does not affect the execution itself, simply the text is wrong.

h3. Workaround

There's currently no workaround for this
fields.summary: Previous Status Condition displayed incorrectly if condition is reverse

fields.description:
h3. Summary
 * In user's profile, update language in user's preference does not work.
 * Upon clicking update, It does not update the language in user's preference.


h3. Customer Impact
 * Users are unable to update their language 

h3. Environment 
- Jira Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
1. Access Jira.
2. Click on avatar on the bottom left
3. Click on profile
4. Edit preferences
5. Select the language desired
6. Click on update

h3. Expected Results
Upon clicking update, the window box will close and the language will be updated after refresh.

h3. Actual Results
The update button loads but the window do not close and language not updated.
fields.summary: Unable to update profile language

fields.description: As a Jira Administrator, I'd like to have the ability to change the field type of a custom field, to be able to edit it instead of having to create a new field and populate it again.
fields.summary: Change the Type of a Custom Field

fields.description:
h3. Summary
In the new Jira UI: 
* When clicking on "Advanced search" on the issues pages the contextual sidebar is replaced with the global sidebar. 
* This causes the loss of all the project context and user needs to navigate through all projects again or the browser's back button

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to a project 
# make some modifications into the project (such as updating an issue)
# Verify that the sidebar is the contextual sidebar
# Go to "Advanced search"
# Verify that the sidebar changes to the "global sidebar"

h3. Expected Results
* Sidebar remains as "contextual sidebar"

h3. Actual Results
* Sidebar changes 

h3. Notes: 
* This happens also when clicking on a component link inside the components view.
fields.summary: Contextual sidebar replaced by global sidebar on advanced search page (New UI)

fields.description:
When Clicking the JIRA issue link to open the full view of the jira issue (e.g. /browse/PROJ-10) then the issue is opened in a new tab. This prevents the end user from being able to choose how they would prefer to open the link as they cannot open the link in the currently open tab.

This can also cause issues for user who want to keep open tabs down to a minimum.
fields.summary: Clicking Issue links to go to Full issue view from Quick View opens issue in new tab, but would prefer opening in the currently open tab.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When the URL of an issue is changed and some character is added, when we comment, then it breaks
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # In an issue, change its URL(sometimes it may be changed by an automation). Eg: [https://domain.atlassian.net/browse/ISSUE-001,\\|https://huddlai.atlassian.net/browse/APPS-475,/] (see the comma)
 # Comment on this issue
 # Then it throws the error: 

!Screen Shot 2018-03-02 at 5.35.11 PM.png|thumbnail!
h3. Expected Results

It is possible to comment normally
h3. Actual Results

It shows an error message and it is not possible to comment.

 
h3. Workaround

Remove the characters added to the URL.
fields.summary: URL modified breaks Jira functions in issues

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When accessing a user profile the following value can be seen as the value for the Autowatch option:
* Inherit from global settings

Which is not editable.

This basically means that the value configured in the User default settings will be applied to all users.
This is not expected as per [Managing your user profile|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/managing-your-user-profile-764478256.html] the user should be able to configure this in his profile.

h3. Expected Results

The Autowatch feature should be configurable per user.

h3. Actual Results

It's only possible to disable/enable it for all users at the user default settings page.
 
h3. Notes

To access the User default page:
{noformat}
https://{instancename}.atlassian.net/secure/admin/ViewUserDefaultSettings.jspa
{noformat}
Documentation for this page:
* [Configuring the user default settings|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/configuring-the-user-default-settings-800708207.html]

h3.Workaround
-
fields.summary: Autowatch options can no longer be configured per user

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

On the old JIRA Experience, there's a shortcut option to Rename, Copy, Remove from Favourites and Delete filters but on the New JIRA Experience, this shortcut doesn't exist.

h3. Suggested Solution

Create shortcut to Rename, Copy, Remove from Favourites and Delete filters.

h3. Why this is important

The shortcut option will create a better user experience for customers.
 
h3. Workaround 
You can edit / delete filters via the Manage Filters Page.
fields.summary: Filters Shortcut Missing on New JIRA Experience

fields.description:
Summary
It appears there's a html problem on the "Issues" menu on a Kanban Board using Norwegian translations

Steps to Reproduce
 # Set language as Norwegian
 # Go to a Kanban Board
 # The menu option for "Issues"(English) shows as "<u>F</u>inn saker" (Norwegian)

Expected Results
Should show as "Finn saker"

Actual Results
"<u>F</u>inn saker"

Workaround
No workaround at the moment
fields.summary: Kanban board menu issues with Norwegian translation

fields.description:
h3.Summary

If the Cloud instance uses JIRA Service Desk, JIRA comment notification should also mention if the comment is a public or an internal comment. This will prevent agents from accidentally replying and revealing information that might otherwise be left private.

This can also apply to comments that are only shared to specific group of users. If the issue comment is only shared to the administrators group then it should be mentioned in the notification as well so that users who receive and read the notification will be more discreet with their replies.
fields.summary: JIRA comment notifications should also mention the availability/visibility of the comment

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Update button doesn't work when trying to change the language via the Profile Page on an instance.
h3. Environment

Cloud
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Visit Profile Page on your instance (instancename.atlassian.net/secure/ViewProfile.jspa)
 # Click the Pen Icon next to Preferences to Edit the language Preference.
 # Change the language
 # Click Update

h3. Expected Results

The language should update to the user's preferred language
h3. Actual Results

The *Update* button doesn't work

 
h3. Workaround

None Available
fields.summary: Update Language button not working on profile

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
- Unable to see all the issues for the linked issue section as it only shows recently viewed issues by the user during the issue creation.
- The issue does not appear even if the issue-key is enrolled in the search bar

h3. Suggested Solution
- Ability to search all the issues

h3. Why this is important
- Users need to be able to use the auto-completion function for all issues within the same project (not issues which were viewed recently only).

h3. Workaround 
- type the issue-key and link it (linked issue will appear on the view screen after the creation)
fields.summary: Ability to search for all the issue in Linked Issue section

fields.description:
h3. Summary

On the issue view on the top right corner there are 3 icon links *Share issue*, *Export issue*, *More* (3 horizontal dots) and none of them have a label that is readable with a screen reader.
 !Screen Shot 2018-03-01 at 18.26.46.png|thumbnail!
h3. Environment

Jira Cloud
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open the view issue page while using a screen reader

h3. Expected Results

The screen reader should be able to identify all icons on the page and read them.
h3. Actual Results

The 3 icon links *Share issue*, *Export issue*, *More* (3 horizontal dots) are not read by the screen reader.
h3. Notes

*Share issue* and *Export issue* have title attributes, but the title is not read by screen readers. *More* (3 horizontal dots) has no title and no accessible label. 
The three horizontal dots is used many places. all need a label. Putting the title as an aria-label attribute would solve the problem on all 3 icons.
 !Screen Shot 2018-03-01 at 18.26.27.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

No workaround
fields.summary: Accessibility - Missing readable label on the icons of the issue view

fields.description: Allow the possibility to edit "Releases" table view, so users can personalize columns positions, names, and the capability to edit as well as add and remove columns from the view.
fields.summary: Ability to edit "Releases" table view

fields.description: As a Jira user, I want to see the gadget title on wallboard view so our users know what they are looking at.
fields.summary: As a Jira user, I want to see the gadget title on wallboard view

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, the Slack add-on has limited functionality in terms of conditions to trigger messages.

The messages can be triggered by issues matching a certain issue type and priority. However, the criteria to send a message to a channel cannot be restricted. For instance, you cannot trigger a message when an issue is created _and_ the assignee is updated. If either of the selected options matches, the message is sent.
 !slack-settings.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggested Solution
Enable the ability to send messages under more complex conditions, for example, to send a message to a channel only when the issue was transitioned to a certain status _and_ someone leaves a comment.

h3. Why this is important
Due to the built-in add-on popularity increasing, this would be a good option for those who don't want to use a third-party add-on. Currently, certain conditions can only be fulfilled using paid add-ons.

h3. Workaround 
None.
fields.summary: Improve the conditions to send messages to Slack rooms

fields.description:
In the [Pros and Cons of Cloud vs. Server|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloudkb/pros-and-cons-of-cloud-vs-server-691011844.html] page, there is a broken link, more specifically in the *Works with Google Apps* at the Pros column.

This is the broken link: https://www.atlassian.com/google-apps
fields.summary: Wrong link reference in the Pros and Cons of Cloud vs. Server page

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When opening the *Issue* link on the project sidebar, the reloaded page will fail to load the sidebar.

 !sidebar.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# In the old JIRA UI, Open a project
# Click on *Issues*

h3. Expected Results

All issues page for the project should be loaded together with the project sidebar.

h3. Actual Results

Project sidebar fails to load.

h3.Workaround

The issue does not replicate on the new JIRA Experience. The new UI can be enabled via the user's avatar and clicking on *Experience the New JIRA*
fields.summary: Sidebar will not load when the project issue link is opened on the old JIRA interface.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When backing up and restoring to another instance, the internal email on Email Requests for Service Desk doesn't change to match the new instance name.
h3. Environment

Tested on Cloud - Exporting from Cloud & Importing into Cloud
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Backup Instance on Instance 1 (example1.atlassian.net)
 # Restore to Instance 2 (example2.atlassian.net)
 # Check Internal Email on Email Requests on Instance 2

h3. Expected Results

The internal email should be [something@example2.atlassian.net|mailto:support@example2.atlassian.net]
h3. Actual Results

The internal email is [something@example1.atlassian.net|mailto:something@example1.atlassian.net]

 
h3. Workaround

Manually update Internal Email to match the new instance name
fields.summary: Service Desk Email Request Internal Email not changing after restore to another instance

fields.description:
h3. Summary
External System Import using the CSV method won't render fields correctly if the Map Field checkbox is selected. 
!2018-03-01_14-56-29.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Customer Impact
Customers are able to import issues from a CSV file, however the formatting of the fields aren't rendered correctly. This would lead customers to manually edit each issue to fix the formatting.

h3. Environment
* Jira Cloud (Jira Software and Jira Service Desk)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to the External System Import{code}https://<instance_name>.atlassian.net/secure/admin/ExternalImport1.jspa{code}
# Select the CSV method
# Select the CSV file to import
# Select the project
# When you are at the next screen titled "Map fields", fill in the description and summary, and enable the Map field value checkbox.

h3. Expected Results
Fields being rendered correctly

h3. Actual Results
Fields not rendered correctly

h3.Workaround
When performing an External System Import using the CSV method don't click the Map Field checkbox. With this unchecked we are able to import your CSV file and have proper formatting of the lists and tables.

# Go to the third screen of the import process titled "Map fields".
# On this page where you map the CSV field to the JIRA field, there is additionally a checkbox for Map field value.
# Leave the checkbox unticked for fields that are having the issue
fields.summary: CSV Import. Tables and Lists won't render correctly

fields.description: It would be very helpful to include the ability to track and report how many times a User has reopened a but or ticket. Doing so would provide Admins with context on who may be performing as expected, and who is potentially missing expectations.
fields.summary: Create Reporting that allows Admins to track a user's reopened tickets

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

In example: When we use *Swimlane* based on a query that search for *Epic Link*, the issues are displayed correctly, however, the sub-tasks are not, they are displayed at the first swimlane of the list.

Steps to test the behavior:
{panel:borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#6A8EB3 |bgColor=#F8F8F8}
# Create 3 Epics.
# Create issues with sub tasks and link the issues to the Epics.
# Base the Swimlanes on *Queries*.
# Use a query to search epics (i.e. _"Epic Link" = 'EPIC-1' OR issuetype in subTaskIssueTypes()_).
{panel}

h3. Suggested Solutions

By default, set to the sub-task the same *Epic Link* of its parent issue.
fields.summary: Subtasks should inherit its parent Epic Link

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Cloud administrators can guide their users to register the display name of their Atlassian Accounts to have a comma between their last name and first name: 

*E.g:* Smith, John

Additionally, since users can now change their own display name by accessing https://id.atlassian.com/manage/account-settings and modifying the *full name* field, they can now make this change anytime even if not previously asked by their administrators. 

When using the *Export Users* feature to generate a CSV file, those accounts will generate a *formatting issue in the resulting file*.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Access https://id.atlassian.com/manage/account-settings
# Change the *Full Name* field using this pattern: {*last name*, *first name*}
# Access a Cloud instance
## Go to *Application picker* >  *Site administration*.
## Click *Export users* at the top-right. Leave the form blank to do a standard export of all users, or customize the export.

h3. Expected Results
When an admin decides to use this pattern or identifies that users are using it, a choice to change the default delimiter from comma to pipe, or quotation marks (single or double) should be available. 

h3. Actual Results
The delimiter is hard coded as a comma which breaks the file formatting
fields.summary: Using a comma between Last Name and First Name breaks the formatting of the file generated by the Export Users functionality

fields.description:
h3. Summary

User gets error *UnknownHostException: mailstore* when pressing the *Test Connection* button after entering in default mail server details
h3. Environment

Cloud
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Delete default mail server - host=mailstore, [username=jira@instance.atlassian.net|mailto:username=jira@instance.atlassian.ne]
 # Add Mail Server
 # Enter any name
 # Use *mailstore* as hostname
 # Use [jira@instance.atlassian.net|mailto:jira@instance.atlassian.net] as username - replace "instance" with the actual instance name
 # Enter anything into the password field
 # Click Test Connection

h3. Expected Results

Show message to say if the connection was established or not.
h3. Actual Results
{noformat}
Unfortunately no connection was possible. Review the errors below and rectify:
                            
UnknownHostException: mailstore                
{noformat}
 
h3. Notes

Even though Jira reports no connection was possible, the mail server still works when clicking *Add* and associating the Mail Server with a Mail Handler
h3. Workaround

None Available
fields.summary: Adding the default Incoming Mail Server causes error - UnknownHostException: mailstore

fields.description: I, as JIRA user, would like to be able to disable the new issue view.
fields.summary: Ability to Disable New Issue View

fields.description:
Summary

Test button on Incoming Mail Handler missing when using the default built-in mail server
h3. Environment

Cloud
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add Mail Handler
 # Enter a name for the Handler
 # Select the built-in Mail Server
 # Click Next

h3. Expected Results

I expect a test button to be present on the page
h3. Actual Results

 
{noformat}
Test button is missing {noformat}
h3. Notes

(Optional - If Necessary)
h3. Workaround

Use a third party mail provider if you want to use the test feature on the mail handler
fields.summary: Test button on Incoming Mail Handler using default mail server

fields.description:
Out of all the awful changes you recently made, hiding quick filters in a dropdown list of checkboxes is probably the worst.

On the old boards the quick filters were handy buttons to toggle filters on and off. Easy to find and easy to see which ones were active.

In the 'improved navigation' board it now takes more clicks to turn filters on and off (click - open dropdown, scroll, click - checkbox instead of just click, button) and it's harder to see which ones are active because the active filters are just a line of text.

 

Nice to see this suggestion board still running on the old version by the way, a reminder of how easy navigation used to be...
fields.summary: Please bring back the old quick filters!

fields.description:
When I go to the project directory of my Jira Software site, I get an error message that says I don't have the browse projects permission. This isn't true, as I _do_ have browse permission.

!image-2018-02-28-15-38-14-007.png|width=213,height=236!

The message is also poorly worded and should be updated.
fields.summary: Incorrect empty state message in project directory

fields.description:
Currently, it's essentially impossible (I think) to filter notifications of mentions in gmail. The result is that I get 10-20 Jira messages per day, but have to open each to find the 1-2/day in which I'm mentioned (and therefore need to reply).

I want a way to filter notifications that mention me in any way so that I can reply. This probably means tags in the subject, but I'm open to any solution that works with gmail.
fields.summary: Make it easy and reliable to filter email notifications

fields.description:
h3. Summary
 * When adding _post functions_ to a workflow transition, it is possible to choose the "*Copy Value From Other Field*" function.
 * This function does not allow you to select the *Status* field as the one to be copied (_Source_), which +should be allowed.+
 * However, this field should not be allowed as a _Destination_ as it does not behave as a regular Jira field. Such an operation could result in an inconsistency in the database tables.
 * *Status* also represents the position of an issue in its workflow. For further information, check [this documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/configuring-statuses-resolutions-and-priorities-776636333.html].

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create project > Edit the workflow > Add the post-function *"Copy Value From Other Field"* on the Create transition

!2018-02-28_15-41-50.png|width=391,height=172,thumbnail!
h3. Expected Results
 * You are able to select *Status* as the _Source Field_.
 * You are NOT able to select *Status* as the _Destination Field._

h3. Actual Results
 * You are not able to select *Status* as the _Source Field_.
 * You are not able to select *Status* as the _Destination Field._

h3. Workaround
 * JIRA Misc Workflow Extensions third part app
fields.summary: "Copy Value From Other Field" post-function should include "Status" as a Source but not as a Destination field

fields.description:
Just as the CSV import process has no verifications for certain Issue Update operations (i.e. updating issue types), the Jira mobile app allows users to update *Issue types* even when the destination type uses different workflows, screens, fields.

This cause some inconsistencies in the database, as the workflow association is not updated accordingly for an example.

h3. Steps to reproduce:
 # First, it is required that a project uses different workflows for different issue types, like in the example below:
  !Screen Shot 2018-02-27 at 1.20.18 PM.png|thumbnail! 
 # Then, in a mobile app, edit an issue's issue type to another that uses a different workflow (i.e. From *Bug* to *Build and Unit Test*)

h3. Expected result:
 * Issue types that use different workflows should not be available in the picklist

h3. Actual result:
 * All issue types related to the project are displayed, allowing you to move to an issue type that uses a different workflow 

h3. Identifying the problem:
 * In order to identify whether an issue is impacted by this, check the database to verify that it is still associated with the original workflow, instead of the expected one:
{code}
select ( p.pkey || '-' || i.issuenum) as issue_key, wse.workflow, wfe.name from jiraissue i join project p on i.project = p.id join nodeassociation na on (na.source_node_id = p.id and source_node_entity = 'Project' and na.sink_node_entity = 'WorkflowScheme') join workflowscheme ws on ws.id = na.sink_node_id join workflowschemeentity wse on wse.scheme = ws.id and wse.issuetype = i.issuetype join os_wfentry wfe on wfe.id = i.workflow_id where wse.workflow != wfe.name union
select ( p.pkey || '-' || i.issuenum) as issue_key, wse2.workflow, wfe.name from jiraissue i join project p on i.project = p.id join nodeassociation na on (na.source_node_id = p.id and source_node_entity = 'Project' and na.sink_node_entity = 'WorkflowScheme') join workflowscheme ws on ws.id = na.sink_node_id left join workflowschemeentity wse1 on wse1.scheme = ws.id and wse1.issuetype = i.issuetype join workflowschemeentity wse2 on wse2.scheme = ws.id and wse2.issuetype = '0' join os_wfentry wfe on wfe.id = i.workflow_id where wse2.workflow != wfe.name and wse1.issuetype is null
{code}

 * The results below describe the fact that the issue type was expected to be associated with the *BP: Process Management Workflow*, but it's still associated to it's original one, *Software Simplified Workflow for Project CEA*
{code}
issue_key,workflow,name
CEA-52,BP: Process Management Workflow,Software Simplified Workflow for Project CEA
{code}

h3. Symptoms: 
 * This not only causes inconsistencies in the database but also in the UI. In the example above, the issue is displayed as if it was in the original workflow's status, which doesn't necessarily exist in the workflow actually associated with that issue type
 !Screen Shot 2018-02-27 at 1.30.15 PM.png|thumbnail!
  !Screen Shot 2018-02-27 at 1.30.26 PM.png|thumbnail! 
 !Screen Shot 2018-02-27 at 1.27.54 PM.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Mobile app allows users to edit Issue Type without verifying workflow differences

h3.Summary

Activity stream gadget throwing error 500

h3.Environment

Jira Core

h3.Steps to Reproduce

# Create a dashboard;
# Add the activity stream gadget;
# Open the inspect browser.

h3.Expected Results

The activity stream gadget works perfectly.

h3.Actual Results

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When an instance has no projects at all, the option to Create projects doesn't appear when you go to Jira Home > Projects as described in our [documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/get-started-with-jira-core/create-a-project-917965385.html]
 Even Jira administrators are not able to see this option on Jira Home > Projects if the instance is empty (without projects)
h3. Customer Impact
h3. Environment
 * This issue happens in the new UI

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Delete all projects from an instance
 # Go to Jira Home > Projects to create a new project

h3. Expected Results

The button *Create Project* should appear

 

!Screen Shot 2018-02-27 at 10.48.56 AM.png|thumbnail!
h3. Actual Results

It doesn't have the option to Create project and a message informing the user doesn't have Browse Project permission appears

!Screen Shot 2018-02-27 at 10.43.56 AM.png|thumbnail!

*Application logs:*
h3. Notes

In the old UI, even when there was no project in the instance, the option Create project was available when clicking on Projects in the top bar.
h3. Workaround

Create the first project by going to Jira Home > Settings > Projects
fields.summary: Create project option doesn't appear on Jira Home > Projects if the instance has no projects

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When user sets default value for issue type in Create Issue Screen it does not work.

 
h3. Steps to Reproduce

1 Click on create issue, choose project and note Issue Type

2 Select a different  Issue Type to previous, create issue with dummy data

3 Create new issue, Issue Type should default to previous issue type created

4 Go to project settings and select Issue type->Choose Actions->Edit Issue Types

5 From here you can edit default issue type and the order they will appear in drop down list but they don't appear to have any bearing when creating a new issue type
h3. Expected Results

Default issue should work under the following conditions as outlined by Dave Mayer:
{quote}While the issues aren't identical, the rationale ends up being the same. JIRA will follow the existing order:
 # Most recently used issue type in user session
 # Default issue type in the issue type scheme
 # Ordering of issues in the issue type scheme

I do not anticipate that we will change this behaviour, as it is key to supporting key features like creating multiple stories in a backlog or creating multiple bugs during a blitz testing session. I will speak to our designers about clarifying the copy on the issue type scheme management page to better indicate how JIRA will behave.
{quote}
h3. Actual Results The below exception is thrown in the xxxxxxx.log file: \{noformat} ... \{noformat}

Issue type will default to last created issue type, then for a new session will default to Task
h3. Notes

As above
h3. Workaround (If there is no workaround directly say so)

No
fields.summary: Default setting for issue type on create issue screen not working

fields.description:
h3. Summary

If the instance had external gadgets added before the [feature deprecation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/removing-unsupported-external-gadgets-from-jira-cloud-913478123.html] these gadgets don't work but are still available to be added on dashboards.
h3. Environment

Jira Cloud instances with external gadgets
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open a dashboard
 # Click on *Add gadgets*
 ## The external gadgets will be listed

h3. Expected Results

External gadgets are removed since they won't work
h3. Actual Results

Gadgets don't work but remain available

 

Notes
h3. Workaround
fields.summary: External gadgets added before the feature deprecation are still available

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The current method to *"archive"* a project is based on modifying the permission scheme that is associated with the project in question and set all the permissions to be empty. This procedure is detailed in the following documentation page: 

* [Archiving a project|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver076/archiving-a-project-945111580.html]

Even though the documentation is targeted to the Server Platform only, this procedure is widely adopted by Cloud users.  

h3. Expected Results

* *First action* 
We should create a separate, dedicated documentation for the Cloud platform to avoid confusion and link it to the *Cloud* switch that is found in the top-right of the screen:
 !archive cloud.png|thumbnail! 

* *Second Action*

We need to include a {color:red}warning{color} to let our cloud customers know that after applying the workaround described in the documentation, regular users won't be able to see the archived projects in the *View Projects* list, but users with administrative permissions will see the projects still being listed. This action needs to be taken to avoid the impression that archiving a project by clearing the permission scheme isn't working as it should. The following BUG was filed some time ago due and was addressing a similar situation: 

* [Projects Tab not Hiding Projects in New Jira Experience|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-67788]
fields.summary: The documentation that explains the current method to archive a project should have a warning and a dedicated version to Cloud

fields.description:
I've a log list of items in a Select List custom field. Users have to navigate through the list to select desired item.

I would like to have autocomplete function in Select List custom field.
fields.summary: Autocomplete Select List Custom Field

fields.description:
h3.Summary

When trying to use the quick search (which is also the mechanism used by some fields - E.g Tempo add-on *log work* field), some specific word patterns aren't returning any results. The behavior can be easily reproducible (please see the steps to reproduce the issue below), however, we still need to find a pattern that would help us to identify all the variations that can result on this misbehavior.

h3.Steps to Reproduce

* Create tickets with the following summaries: 
** Operational IT
** Operational AT
** Operational AB 
** Operational ITT
** Operational AS
** Operational IS
** Operational IN
* Go to quick search (shortcut: */*)and search for the above summaries
* JIRA will return the following: 
** (x) Operational IT - The search will stop showing this issue after you type the letter *I*
** (x) Operational AT - Same as above, but after typing letter *A*
** (/) Operational AB - Search will return the issue as expected
** (/) Operational ITT - Search will return the issue as expected
** (x) Operational AS - The search will stop showing this issue after you type the letter *A*
** (x) Operational IS - The search will stop showing this issue after you type the letter *I*
** (x) Operational IN - Same as above


h3.Expected Results

The search feature should find the issues.

h3.Actual Results

After typing specific letters, the issue will stop showing in the search field. 

h3.Workaround

No workaround at the moment

h3. Notes

(?) It seems that it happens mostly with words that could be considered "reserved", like "AT", "IT", "AS", "IS".
fields.summary: Some specific word patterns are preventing issues to be returned by JIRA quick search mechanism

fields.description:
When custom fields are deleted because of an add-on that is disabled, they still appear as null on the screens. This can result in a bug for scriptrunner validators: the screen is not drawn.

*Workaround:* re-create the transition screen from scratch so the deleted fields don't interfere with Scriptrunner.

Still, you need to know if the fields are resulting in null so I think it would be useful to include a 'Check screens for references to deleted custom fields' in the Integrity Checker, similar to the 'Check field configurations for references to deleted custom fields'.
fields.summary: include 'Check screens for references to deleted custom fields' in Integrity Checker

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
The description of 'Issue Type' is not showing on *Create Issue* screens, even updated the field description via Field Configurations.

h3. Suggested Solution
Show the field description as other fields.

h3. Why this is important
* Field description is used to make sure users know what is the purpose of the field and make sure they choose the right option.

h3. Workaround 
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Create issue screen should display description of the Issue Type

fields.description: The ability to quickly modify the issue security is a great feature to Jira mobile. Would be useful if the Jira cloud Mobile app has the feature to set issue security level. Granting to the users the ability to set this directly on his mobile.
fields.summary: Ability to set issue security in Jira Mobile

fields.description:

In the new Jira UI, the summary lines don't wrap during the bulk operation.
- Bulk operation in the old UI:
 !old-layout.png|thumbnail! 
- In the new UI:
 !new-layout.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggested Solution
Add a word wrap to make longer summaries visible in the bulk operation.

h3. Why this is important
This feature was working on the old layout - Adding a word wrap will be useful to keep the reference of each issue summary during the operation.

h3. Workaround 
None.

fields.description:

Even after a customer deletes an attachment from an issue it is still visible on the attachment form under Recent Uploads. I understand it is attached only to the specific user but it can create concerns that potentially sensitive information is still 'in the cloud' even after deleting.

h3. Suggested Solution

 # If a user deletes an attachment from an issue it should also remove it from recent uploads

h3. Workaround
There's no Workaround available at this time.
fields.summary: User should be able to delete attachments from Recent Upload attachments form

h3. Summary

Gadget menus get cut off and remove access to the edit option for thin gadget located at the bottom of the dashboard layout.
h3. Environment

JIRA Cloud - JIRA v1000.285.1
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a JIRA Dashboard
 # Add a thin gadget like Activity Stream at the bottom of the dashboard
 # Open the gadget menu to edit the gadget 

h3. Expected Results

The gadget menu should extend the limit of the layout or take over it without being hidden to access the full gadget menu.
h3. Actual Results

The menu is cut off,  the gadget has to be moved to an upper position or another taller gadget must be placed next to it to extend the dashboard layout bottom limit.

!Screen Shot 2018-02-23 at 11.30.13.png|width=381,height=252!

 

workaround:

Move the gadget to an upper position or next to another taller gadget to extend the dashboard layout bottom limit.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The full search results for a group cannot be returned on the People and on grant project permission configuration pages. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Create groups with 20+ variations of the string *users* ( ie. a1_users, a2_users, a3_users, ... users)
# Search for the string *users* in *Project Settings > People > Add Role*
# Search for the group *users* in *Project Settings > Permissions > Edit Permissions > Grant Permissions > Group*

h3. Expected Results

All the available groups containing the string users can be retrieved.


h3. Actual Results

If the group is not returned in the first 20 results, there is no way to retrieve the rest of the results. The scroll bar does not trigger loading of the the rest of results. 

!grant.png|thumbnail!  

!people.png|thumbnail!

h3. Problem Definition
Cannot export user list of a specific project like it can be done in User Management

h3. Suggested Solution
Functionality to export the list of user from the People section of a project. 

h3. Workaround
# Create a group of users of a specific project.
# Export the group from user management

The workaround is however not suitable for user groups that exist in the project.
fields.summary: Export User list Project wise

fields.description: A confirmation message that displays on the page stating that the updates have been saved would make for a better user experience or once saving being redirected to the view page versus the edit page.
fields.summary: Confirmation message when changing the project name

fields.description:
JIRA does not provide a built-in feature to generate and export usage and growth reports. Administrators have to control and verify instance usage and growth manually and then generate the reports using a separate tool.

Please implement a feature that allows administrators to get the below information in an easy way, generate the reports/charts and export them to common formats.
* Total number of users and its growth month over month
* Total number of projects by type and its growth month over month
* Total number of user groups and its users
* Total number of concurrent users in the different applications
* Show the peak usage monthly wise for the applications

Having a better way to verify usage and growth and reporting it has several uses, such as:
* Manage licensing
* Track users and customers adoption
* Justify new investments in the application
fields.summary: As a JIRA Admin i want to be able to generate usage and growth report charts and be able to export them in a readable format.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

In Jira Cloud, there is no option to choose which attachment to download. The only available option is to either download one by one or download all.
h3. Suggested Solution

Allows to easily download all attachments as zip for selected issues/projects.
h3. Workaround
* Download one by one.
* Download all attachment using the backup option.
* Use [REST API|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v3/?utm_source=%2Fcloud%2Fjira%2Fplatform%2Frest%2F&utm_medium=302#api-api-3-applicationrole-key-get] to retrieve attachment URLs and download them.
* Use the third-party app: [Bulk Attachment Download|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1220266/bulk-attachment-download?hosting=cloud&tab=overview]
fields.summary: Option to download all attachments at once from all issues in search results

fields.description:

Expected: The types and statuses will be displayed only when there are issues affected by this migration (see screenshot).
fields.summary: Associate Workflow Scheme to Project displays unrelated statuses/issue types

fields.description:
Inside backlog view, after you select multiple issues you have several actions available when you click the right button of the mouse.

It would be very handy to have the possibility to set the assignee of the multiple issues selected in one shot.

Maybe under other actions, the new option should read something like "set assignee"

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When defining a component for an issue that is already created, the issue will not automatically assign to the component lead.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a component with a component lead and set the default assignee to the component lead.
# Create an issue
# Set the component for the issue

h3. Expected Results
* The issue should be automatically assigned to the component lead.

h3. Actual Results
* The issue is not automatically assigned to the component lead.
fields.summary: Default Assignee by Component is not working after issue creation

fields.description:
h3.Summary

Currently the value in a select list custom field displays based on how the user has arranged them in the field configurations. 

It will be great if there is a feature that can automatically sort the values as arranging them manually is inconvenient if there are a lot of values in the list.

Additionally, do also allow these values to be grouped together in different groups. Visually, groups will be separated by a separator on the select list custom field.
fields.summary: Allow option to sort and group configured values in a select list custom field

fields.description:
h2. *Current Behaviour*

At the moment CRM contact is not mapped individually to issues, rather, when you attach a contact to issue, it updates all issues as well with the last contact that you have updated.

h2. *Requested Behaviour*

User can attach CRM contacts to a specific issue without affecting other issues.
fields.summary: Allow CRM contacts to be mapped individually to issues when using CRM for JIRA Cloud add on

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Having a workflow scheme using more than one workflow and setting up properties for a status in one of the workflow will impact the status in every workflow.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a project and a workflow scheme with 2 workflows
# Configure the workflows to have the same status
# In one of the workflows add the permission properties to one of the status indicating the roles that can edit issues:
{noformat}
jira.issue.editable = true
jira.permission.edit.projectrole.1 = 10002
jira.permission.edit.projectrole.2 = 10202
{noformat}
Where 10002 and 10202 are the roles ids(Administrators and developers and status is To Do in this example).
# Impersonate a user that is not in any of those roles.
# The user won't be able to edit any issues in the To Do status in any issue types as this will be applied to all the workflows.

h3. Expected Results
Only the issue types assigned to the workflow containing these properties should be affected.

h3. Actual Results
The permission properties affect all the workflows and thus all the issue types in the project.
 
h3. Notes
This should be happening for other properties.
Cloud [documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/workflow-properties-776636709.html] reference for properties.
This is important for customers that need different permissions depending on the issue type.

h3.Workaround
Remove the properties from the workflow using them or have different statuses in each workflow.
fields.summary: Workflow status properties being applied to all workflows inside a workflow scheme

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, a summary of the error messages thrown while trying to create an issue is visible at the top of the create issue screen. This can cause the user to keep trying to submit the issue till she/he realizes that there are errors and the messages are at the top of the screen.

h3. Suggested Solution

The error should be visible no matter where we are in the form, preferably in a pop-up.
fields.summary: Errors when creating a new issue should be visible without scrolling up the screen

fields.description:
h3.Summary

When searching for independent words using text and text, Jira doesn't return any result.

h3.Steps to Reproduce

* Create a ticket with the summary "Test 1" and comment on it "Test 2";
* Go to advanced search and search for *text ~ "Test 1"*;
* Jira will find the recently created issue;
*  !Screen Shot 2018-02-21 at 14.31.56.png|thumbnail! 
* Search for *text ~ "Test 1" and text ~ "Test 2"*;
* Jira won't find anything.
*  !Screen Shot 2018-02-21 at 14.32.16.png|thumbnail! 

h3.Expected Results

Jira should find the issue.

h3.Actual Results

Jira returns nothing.

h3. Summary
If user's email address is used to add the user in a custom field *User Picker (multiple users)*, the user won't be added to the custom field. This occurs when the user's email address and username are different, as if the username and email address are same, CSV import will add the user to the field. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a project (eg. Business project).
# Add user A (ensure the username and email address are different).
# Create a custom field (e.g "Test Multi User Picker") with *User Picker (multiple users)* type, and add it to screens (create/edit/view screens) of the project (step 1).
# Use the following sample data to create issue using CSV Import (in below example, username is *user* and email address is *user@example.com*):
{code}
Issue Type, Summary, Test Multi User Picker, Reporter
Task, Test issue 1, user@example.com, user@example.com
Task, Test issue 2, user, user@example.com
{code}

h3. Expected Results
User wiht email address "user@example.com" be added to the custom field "Test Multi User Picker" in both issues

h3. Actual Results
* In "Test issue 1" the user won't be added to the "Test Multi User Picker"
* However, in "Test issue 2" the user will be added to the field.

h3. Notes

This bug is applicable for both the Single user and Multi-user picker Custom Fields.

h3. Workaround
Ensure to use username to add the user in custom field *User Picker (multiple users)*
fields.summary: CSV import does not add user to the custom field "User Picker (multiple users)" when the user's email address is used

fields.description:
We are using:
 * Jira software for backlog and boards
 * portfolio for portfoliomanagement
 * confluence for sharing knowledge, team documentation, project documentation
 * stride for collaboration and communication
 * Bitbucket for for sourcemanagement

When we setup a new project we have to:
 * add a project in Jira
 * add the project ot a plan in portfolio
 * add the team in portfolio
 * add the project work space in confluence, add the team members manually
 * add the project room in stride, add the team members manually
 * add the repository in bitbucket, add the team members manually

It would be great it this can be achieved with a wizard that set's up our applications in a few simple steps.

h3. Summary

When sorting by createdDate it also sorts by time just like Created. There is no difference.

Created two issues. issue 01 and issue 02.

Created and createdDate should produce different results but they do not

No workaround

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Recently, having multiple handles for the same server is causing very long delay on email processing. This happens when different handlers are set to handle different emails, for example, based on catch email.

After investigation we found out that handlers are running with the correct delay, only they are not processing the emails.

This seems to be mostly due to locks. When the handlers are run, they frequently show this:
{code}
Message <message ID here> has an active email lock. Won't continue processing
{code}

Followed by:
{code}
Message '<same message ID here>' in server '10004' won't be processed 
{code}

So, it seems that one handler is locking the message, but won't create a ticket for it, as the catch email for that message doesn't match its configuration. When other handlers run (including the one that should process the message), instead of waiting for the lock to be released, they just ignore the message.

So, the handler with a matching catch email will only actually process the message when it, by chance, reaches the email message when it's not locked. The odds of that happening decrease as the number of handlers increase.

Testing in an inbox with 2 emails and having 11 handlers configured for the same inbox (each with a different catch email and only one could process the message), even though all handlers were running every minute it took one hour for the message to be processed.

This seems to be have been caused by the fix for this bug:
[JRACLOUD-67475|https://jira.atlasian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-67475]


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Must be in an affected instance
# Create several handlers for the same server, only with different catch email
#* Make sure delay is 1 minute for all (to make reproducing it easier, but this bug happens for different delay configurations)
# Send an email to the inbox configured so it will only be processed by 1 of those

h3. Expected Results

Since the handler that can process it is run every 1 minute, the message is processed within 1 minute.

h3. Actual Results
The message takes very long to be processed, in tests, up to an hour with 11 handlers.

h3.Workaround
*Untested workaround:* Try changing delay and adding different delays to different handlers, so they are less likely to run at the same time.
fields.summary: Several handlers to the same server is preventing messages from being processed

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Update - 4 JULY 2019|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#2684ff|titleBGColor=#2684ff|bgColor=#ffffff}

Hi, 

Thank you for your feedback on Jira Cloud performance. 

This ticket was originally created to report slowness when loading the sidebar in the new Jira experience. Over the last few months, we've shipped multiple performance improvements to tackle this and other performance issues. You can read the latest update on performance in the [Atlassian Community|https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Jira-articles/6-ways-we-ve-improved-performance-in-Jira-Cloud/ba-p/1118182].  

Since shipping these improvements, we're happy to share that the sidebar in the new Jira experience now loads twice as fast: 

!Jira Cloud Faster Navigation.gif|width=600, height=250!

With the comments on this ticket, you have openly shared your experiences with Jira Cloud and helped us build a better product. We want to sincerely apologize for the frustration caused by this and other performance issues. 

Moving forward, in order for us to better identify and prioritize the performance issues that still impact you, we ask that you open new tickets based on your latest experience [here|https://getsupport.atlassian.com/]. We're closing this ticket today.

We're continuing to actively work on providing you with a superior performance experience in Jira Cloud. 

Nikhil Kulkarni
Senior Product Manager
Jira Cloud Performance

{panel}
\\

{panel:title=Atlassian Update - 14 MAY 2019|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#2684ff|titleBGColor=#2684ff|bgColor=#ffffff}

Hi, 

We’re happy to share some updates with you on the performance improvements we’ve been working on these past few months:

*Faster Navigation Sidebar*
We've shipped a Jira navigation sidebar that loads twice as fast as the previous version. This is now available to all customers.

*Jira as a Single Page App (SPA) - faster transitions between Jira pages*
We’re progressing well in this journey, having completed much of the work that will enable us to bring more experiences into the SPA. We've already shipped fast SPA transitions between directories and next-gen Jira Software projects. Soon, this will be expanded to include the new issue view, classic Jira Software projects, and dashboards.

*Reducing the size of our frontend resources*
Through a number of build and delivery improvements, we're now serving much smaller frontend resources (e.g. JavaScript files), so Jira experiences become ready for interaction sooner. Next up, we're continuing our work to reduce the number and size of downloaded files.

Stay tuned for the next update!

Cheers, 
 Nikhil Kulkarni 
 Senior Product Manager 
 Jira Cloud Platform
{panel}
\\

{panel:title=Atlassian Update - 06 FEB 2019|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#2684ff|titleBGColor=#2684ff|bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi,

Thank you for your continued feedback on Jira Cloud performance. As Scott mentioned, we very much understand the impact of this issue and are actively working towards a scalable solution.

Here’s what we’ve been working on over the past couple of months:

*_Faster preview in the new issue experience_*

In the [new Jira issue view|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiracorecloud/the-new-jira-issue-view-938040503.html], we’ve optimised the loading time of the issue preview (including the issue title, key fields, and description). This experience is available to a number of users already and will be rolled out to more users in the coming months.

*_Improvements to next-gen boards and backlogs_*

In [next-gen Jira Software projects|https://www.atlassian.com/blog/jira-software/the-new-jira-begins-now], switching between boards, the backlog, roadmaps, and the project configuration pages now happens in a Single Page App (SPA). This, combined with an optimised board issue view, helps load content faster.

*_A Single Page App (SPA) for Jira_*

We're working on enabling more SPA transitions within Jira. This will create a more seamless navigation experience between different parts of the product.

*_Improvements to the sidebar navigation experience_*

We have also started working to improve the performance of the sidebar and, in turn, speed up the way you navigate around Jira. We’ll make sure to share news on improvements here.

*_New AWS regions in Sydney and Singapore_*

We have opened up new AWS regions in Sydney and Singapore to improve the performance for our APAC customers.

*_Simplified frontend architecture_*

In addition to the above changes, we're simplifying our frontend architecture to help us transform Jira into an SPA, accelerate initial page loads using a technique called Server-Side Rendering (SSR), and apply much smarter caching techniques. Some of this work has already been completed and some is just getting started, with each piece driving us toward a simpler, faster Jira that’s smaller in size and loads far less data.

Thanks again for your patience on this issue, and stay tuned for the next update.

Cheers, 
 Nikhil Kulkarni 
 Senior Product Manager 
 Jira Cloud Platform
{panel}
 \\
{panel:title=Atlassian Update - 05 DEC 2018|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#2684ff|titleBGColor=#2684ff|bgColor=#ffffff}
{panel}
Hi,

Thank you for your feedback and your patience. We understand your frustration and are actively working on addressing the performance issues in Jira. In fact, improving Jira’s performance is one of our top company goals and we are hard at work on it.

That said, it’s an ongoing journey and we intend to make significant progress as we move ahead. There are some things we’ve already done, areas we are currently working on and items in the pipeline through which we aim to deliver a superior performance experience. Here are some key highlights on the performance work:

*_Building newer experiences with performance in mind_* - We’re focusing on the key experiences that a large number of you interact with and making sure that they’re performant.

The Issue experience, for example, is perhaps what most of you interact with and that’s currently our area of focus. Here’s some insight into how we’re thinking about building it - [A sneak peek into the future of Jira Cloud issues|https://www.atlassian.com/blog/jira-software/a-sneak-peek-into-the-future-of-jira-cloud-issues] (blog post) and [video|https://youtu.be/EE22Ll6LIME?t=3326] from Europe 2018 Summit (55:26 onwards). We’re constantly working on making the new Issue experience fast and easy to use. Some of you may already be on this new experience and we plan to take this all our customers in the coming months. Like we are for Issue experience, we’re working on making the Navigation experience is both fast and easy to use.

*_Jira as an SPA_* - One of our key initiatives is turning Jira into an SPA (Single Page Application). An SPA delivers a much superior experience from a performance perspective. For a product of Jira’s nature and complexity, this is a fairly significant effort and we’re on it in the right earnest. We’ve shipped this to some of our new experiences (next-gen boards, for example) and will be rolling it out to other parts of Jira over time.

*_Expanding our cloud footprint_*- We made a major decision of moving from our own data center to AWS cloud. This would enable us to better deliver value to you, our customers, by focusing on delivering features (and not managing IT infrastructure) and also scale smoothly for our fast-growing customer base with better performance. We completed migrating all our customers to AWS early this year. You can read more about our move to AWS here - on [TechCrunch|https://techcrunch.com/2018/04/02/atlassians-two-year-cloud-journey] and [Forbes|http://fortune.com/2017/05/02/atlassian-goes-all-in-with-aws]. In order to support our growing customer base and make sure we’re closer to where our customers are, we are adding newer AWS regions. In addition to the existing regions in the US and Ireland, we are adding AWS regions in Sydney, Frankfurt and Singapore.

Thank you for bearing with us. Be rest assured that performance is a top priority for us and we’re actively working on it. We’ll keep you posted on updates and new developments regarding performance.

Thank you,

Nikhil Kulkarni
 Senior Product Manager
 Jira Cloud Performance

h3. Summary

A few user are facing slowness while loading the new Jira layout
h3. Environment
 * Jira Cloud + New jira experience

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Access Jira
 ** This issue can be noticed on boards, issue navigator and dashboards

h3. Expected Results

Layout (sidebar, buttons...) is loaded as soon as the issues are shown.
h3. Actual Results

Jira hangs while loading the sidebar and other layout artifacts
h3. Notes

This bug description is a bit generic and we may split this in order to address the different possible causes. One of the causes identified  so far is that the JavaScript for the navigation bar (and not only) takes long time to download despite x-cache: Hit from Cloudfront. In this case the observed behavior is the following:
 - JS downloads take over 8 s
 - Jira frontend is perceived as slow
 - Jira backend responds under 4 s

We will update this ticket in the next days to provide more details or just to link it to a new bug ticket specific to the above scenario.
h3. Workaround

Users can try disabling the browser extensions as there are cases where this change improves the performance.
fields.summary: Slowness while loading the new Jira layout

h3. Summary
When a user clicks on an issue from the Activity Stream gadget, the user will be redirected to the issue. However, when attempting to go back to the Dashboard by clicking "Back" on the browser, nothing happens (user is not redirected back to the Dashboard).

h3. Environment
 - Atlassian Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to a Dashboard which has the Activity Stream gadget.
# Click on any of the issues shown in the gadget.
# Once you are redirected to the issue, click on "Back" (on the browser), or use the shortcut Alt+Left.

h3. Expected Results
The user will be redirected back to the Dashboard.

h3. Actual Results
Nothing happens. The user stays in the issue.

 !Back-Button.png|thumbnail!

fields.description:
Currently when using both the SCRUM and Kanban boards in Jira the backlog is very hard to quickly prioritise when the team has a very long backlog.

The teams I work with who use the Kanban backlog often have a backlog of over 500 issues, there seems to be no way to easily move issues into the correct order. When you have a large backlog dragging issues is a very slow process. 

We would would like to have a feature that makes this process more efficient either by:

1) Allowing the user to zoom out so that when moving an issue low down on the backlog to in the middle or near the top it would be easier OR

2) Allowing the user to rank using numbers OR

3) When right clicking you can add move to top of backlog or move to bottom but maybe there could be more options here OR

This is one of the most frustrating issues currently when moving issues in the backlog.
fields.summary: Ability to prioritise issues in the backlog view more easily

h3. Summary

When attempting to pull the "Time in Status" data from Jira REST API, it seems that the field is only updated when the issue is resolved (has a value in the Resolution field). If the issue has been transitioned a few times, but never had the value in the Resolution field, the custom field will still show "null".

h3. Environment
 - Atlassian Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Jira issue.
# Transition it to a new status which does not set the Resolution field.
# Since the REST endpoint we are using is a GET, we can directly check through the browser.
#- Through the browser, go to "<instance-name>.atlassian.net/rest/api/2/issue/<issue-key>"
# In the returned results, search for the value of customfield_<ID of Time In Status custom field>.
#- For example, "customfield_10013".

h3. Expected Results

The "Time in Status" custom field should show the time that the issue was in the first status. For example,
{code}
"customfield_10013":"1_*:*_1_*:*_16552_*|*_10002_*:*_1_*:*_0"
{code}

h3. Actual Results

The "Time in Status" custom field shows as null.
{code}
"customfield_10013":null
{code}

h3. Workaround

None
fields.summary: "Time in Status" custom field only updates when the issue is Resolved

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently the add-on version stated in the Manage add-ons page in JIRA, indicates the version by Atlassian Connect. This version differs with the one add-on's vendor uses in their products and docs.
 For example, currently *1.0.27-AC* is the version stated by Atlassian Connect for *Zephyr for Jira Cloud*, which can be seen in Manage add-ons page:
 !JIRA Manage Add-ons.png|thumbnail! 
 However, if we check the add-on version at *Test* > *About Zephyr*, the version provided by vendor is *2.2*:
 !About Zephyr.png|thumbnail!

This could sometimes cause confusion as the add-on's vendor mentions and use their own versions in communication with customers, and when customers refer to JIRA Manage add-ons page, they see different version.
h3. Suggested Solution

Include the add-on version that is announced/used by the vendor in the Manage add-ons page in JIRA.
fields.summary: Include add-on's version provided by the vendor in the JIRA manage add-ons page

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, there is limits set for email notifications for instances with evaluation license, to prevent spamming. This limits persists even if the payment details are provided, and customer needs to wait until the end of evaluation license, to be converted to a paid license.

This prevents users from receiving any notifications from JIRA, which impacts customer's business. 
h3. Suggested Solution

Have a feature where customer can choose either:
 * To opt out from evaluation license earlier, and be converted to paid license. Or,

 * To wait until the end of evaluation license, and then be converted to paid license.
fields.summary: Ability to opt out from evaluation license, and be converted to paid license before evaluation license ends

fields.description:
h2. Doc Link:
 * [https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/configuring-a-custom-field-776636423.html#Configuringacustomfield-Howtofilterusersforuserpickerfields]

 
h2. Current Documentation:
{quote}
How to filter users for user picker fields

You can limit the set of users available in your user picker field to specific groups or project roles. To filter users, follow these steps: 
 # Select *Jira home* *>* *Settings >* *Issues*.
 # In the Fields section, click *Custom Fields*.
 # Find the custom field you want to configure and click   !https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/files/945104532/945104534/1/1497849358491/Screen+Shot+2017-06-19+at+3.15.09+PM.png|width=24!  > *Configure* > *Edit Options* > *Edit User Filtering*.
 # Click *Enable group or project role filtering*, then specify the groups and roles that you want to limit the user picker to.
 The user picker will only show users that are in the groups and roles selected.
 # Click *Save*.{quote}
h2. Problem
 * Group/Project role filter is *only* possible for the custom field type *User Picker (single user)*. Cannot follow this KB if the user selects a *User Picker (multiple users)*
 * Causing confusion if the Admin user is following Step 3,  since the option is not there
 * Admin Expects this:
 !Screen Shot 2018-02-16 at 3.44.14 pm.png|thumbnail! 
 !Screen Shot 2018-02-16 at 3.21.14 pm.png|thumbnail!

Feature request for User Picker (muti users)

fields.summary: Fix Documentation for the user picker fields

fields.description:
The documentation that explains how to save a filter ([Subscribing to your search results|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiracoreserver/working-with-search-results-939937784.html#Workingwithsearchresults-subscribeSubscribingtoyoursearchresults]) and create a subscription that will send periodic notifications containing the results returned by a filter could be improved by adding a link to the following documentation pages: 

* [Managing your user profile|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/managing-your-user-profile-764478256.html]
* [Configuring the user default settings|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/configuring-the-user-default-settings-800708207.html]

This is important because when the *Default outgoing email format* setting on the *User Default Settings* page of a instance is set to *Text*, all newly created accounts will have their *E-mail type* option (located on their profiles) set to *Text* as well. This will make all notification e-mails sent by the subscription show up on plain text. This usually leads to confusion since the notification e-mail appearance end up looking as it's broken.
fields.summary: Improve the documentation regarding filter subscriptions to contain a link to the "Configuring the user default settings" and "Managing your user profile" documentation pages

fields.description:
h3. Summary
 * If the username starts with a whitespace an error shows up when adding the user
 * Shown error : "connections breakdown close this dialog and ress refresh in your browser"
 * Shown error : "The user xxxxxxx@xxxxxx.com could not be found. This user will not be added to watch list."

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add a use with a username that starts with a space.
 # go to a test issue
 # ensure you have permission to manage watchers
 # ensure the created user has browse project permission for that project.
 # Try to add this user as a watcher to watch list.
 # an error shows up "The user xxxxxxx@xxxxxx.com could not be found. This user will not be added to watch list."
 # The console will show error 402.

h3. Expected Results
 * User added as watcher.

h3. Actual Results
 * User not added as watcher and an error shows up

h3. Notes
 * This also happens if username ends with a space 
 * I recommend to consider re-opening this feature suggestion Trailing space in username causes login failure.

h3. Workaround
 * There's no workaround at the moment.
fields.summary: Unable to add user as watcher if username starts/ends with a Whitespace

h3. Problem Definition

There's no way to sort the list of screens alphabetically

Sort the list of screens alphabetically or provide the option to sort by alphabetical

Some teams have a large amount of screens and being able to sort them will improve their efficency to find the needed screen
